info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Alexander and northeastern Caldwell Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Boomer, or 4 miles southeast of Elkville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylorsville, Cedar Rock, Hiddenite, Kings Creek, Vashti, Ellendale, Millersville and Little River In Alexander County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
